intro: Sida chanetii, commonly known as the narrowleaf sida, is a flowering plant native to parts of the Americas. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant typically grows as an annual herb with slender stems and small, hairy leaves. Its flowers are usually pale pink to white, and it produces small, capsule-like fruits. Sida chanetii is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of environmental conditions.
